vcf_agent package¶

Submodules¶

vcf_agent.agent module¶

vcf_agent.bcftools_integration module¶

Python wrapper for bcftools view, query, and filter commands. Uses subprocess for robust execution and output/error capture. Extensible for additional bcftools commands.

vcf_agent.bcftools_integration.bcftools_annotate(args, input_data=None)¶

Run bcftools annotate with the given arguments.

Parameters:

  • args (List[str]) – Arguments for bcftools annotate.

  • input_data (Optional[bytes]) – Optional bytes to pass to stdin.

Returns:

(returncode, stdout, stderr)

Return type:

Tuple[int, str, str]

Example

>>> bcftools_annotate(["-a", "annots.vcf", "sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz"])
(0, '...', '')
vcf_agent.bcftools_integration.bcftools_filter(args, input_data=None)¶

Run bcftools filter with the given arguments.

Parameters:

  • args (List[str]) – Arguments for bcftools filter.

  • input_data (Optional[bytes]) – Optional bytes to pass to stdin.

Returns:

(returncode, stdout, stderr)

Return type:

Tuple[int, str, str]

Example

>>> bcftools_filter(["-e", "QUAL<20", "sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz"])
(0, '...', '')

vcf_agent.bcftools_integration.bcftools_query(args, input_data=None)¶

Run bcftools query with the given arguments.

Args:

args (List[str]): Arguments for bcftools query. input_data (Optional[bytes]): Optional bytes to pass to stdin.

Returns:

Tuple[int, str, str]: (returncode, stdout, stderr)

Example:
>>> bcftools_query(["-f", "%CHROM       %POS
“, “sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz”])

(0, ‘…’, ‘’)

Parameters:

  • args (List[str])

  • input_data (bytes | None)

Return type:

Tuple[int, str, str]

vcf_agent.bcftools_integration.run_bcftools_command(command, input_data=None)¶

Run a bcftools command and capture output and errors.

Parameters:

  • command (List[str]) – List of command arguments (e.g., [“view”, “-h”, “file.vcf”])

  • input_data (Optional[bytes]) – Optional bytes to pass to stdin.

Returns:

(returncode, stdout, stderr)

Return type:

Tuple[int, str, str]

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If bcftools is not installed.

Example

>>> run_bcftools_command(["view", "-h", "sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz"])
(0, '...', '')

vcf_agent.cli module¶

vcf_agent.config module¶

Configuration module for VCF Analysis Agent.

  • Stores global configuration for compliance tools and references

  • Can be extended for environment management and advanced settings

vcf_agent.config.CONFIG = {'compliance_tool': 'bcftools', 'gatk_reference': None, 'manufacturer_tool': None}¶

Global configuration dictionary for the VCF Analysis Agent.

Keys:

compliance_tool (str): Compliance tool to use (‘bcftools’, ‘gatk’, or manufacturer/tool name) gatk_reference (Optional[str]): Path to reference FASTA for GATK manufacturer_tool (Optional[str]): Name of manufacturer-specific tool

Usage:
>>> from vcf_agent.config import CONFIG
>>> CONFIG["compliance_tool"]
'bcftools'

vcf_agent.gatk_integration module¶

Python wrapper for GATK ValidateVariants command. Uses subprocess for robust execution and output/error capture. Extensible for additional GATK commands.

vcf_agent.gatk_integration.gatk_validatevariants(args, input_data=None)¶

Run GATK ValidateVariants with the given arguments.

Parameters:

  • args (List[str]) – Arguments for GATK ValidateVariants.

  • input_data (Optional[bytes]) – Optional bytes to pass to stdin.

Returns:

(returncode, stdout, stderr)

Return type:

Tuple[int, str, str]

Example

>>> gatk_validatevariants(["-V", "sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz", "-R", "ref.fasta"])
(0, '...', '')
vcf_agent.gatk_integration.run_gatk_command(command, input_data=None)¶

Run a GATK command and capture output and errors.

Parameters:

  • command (List[str]) – List of command arguments (e.g., [“ValidateVariants”, “-V”, “file.vcf”])

  • input_data (Optional[bytes]) – Optional bytes to pass to stdin.

Returns:

(returncode, stdout, stderr)

Return type:

Tuple[int, str, str]

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If GATK is not installed.

Example

>>> run_gatk_command(["ValidateVariants", "-V", "sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz", "-R", "ref.fasta"])
(0, '...', '')

vcf_agent.validation module¶

VCF/BCF File I/O and Validation Logic - File existence and format checks - Index detection (bgzip, CSI/TBI) - Integration with bcftools stats/validate - Error reporting

vcf_agent.validation.compliance_check(filepath, tool=None)¶

Unified compliance checker for VCF/BCF files. Selects backend based on config or argument.

Parameters:

  • filepath (str) – Path to the VCF/BCF file.

  • tool (Optional[str]) – Compliance tool to use (‘bcftools’, ‘gatk’, etc.).

Returns:

(returncode, stdout, stderr)

Return type:

Tuple[int, str, str]

Example

>>> compliance_check('sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz', tool='bcftools')
(0, '...', '')
vcf_agent.validation.file_exists(filepath)¶

Check if the file exists and is readable.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – Path to the file.

Returns:

True if the file exists and is readable, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Example

>>> file_exists('sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz')
True
vcf_agent.validation.has_index(filepath)¶

Check for the presence of a CSI or TBI index for bgzipped VCF/BCF files.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – Path to the file.

Returns:

True if index is present or not required, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Example

>>> has_index('sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz')
True
vcf_agent.validation.is_vcf_or_bcf(filepath)¶

Check if the file has a VCF, VCF.GZ, or BCF extension.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – Path to the file.

Returns:

True if the file has a recognized VCF/BCF extension, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Example

>>> is_vcf_or_bcf('sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz')
True
vcf_agent.validation.validate_vcf_file(filepath, tool=None)¶

High-level validation: checks existence, format, index, and compliance (configurable backend).

Parameters:

  • filepath (str) – Path to the VCF/BCF file.

  • tool (Optional[str]) – Compliance tool to use (‘bcftools’, ‘gatk’, etc.).

Returns:

(is_valid, error_message_if_any)

Return type:

Tuple[bool, Optional[str]]

Example

>>> validate_vcf_file('sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz')
(True, None)
vcf_agent.validation.validate_with_bcftools_stats(filepath)¶

Run bcftools stats on the file.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – Path to the VCF/BCF file.

Returns:

(returncode, stdout, stderr)

Return type:

Tuple[int, str, str]

Example

>>> validate_with_bcftools_stats('sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz')
(0, '...', '')
vcf_agent.validation.validate_with_gatk(filepath, reference=None)¶

Run GATK ValidateVariants on the file.

Parameters:

  • filepath (str) – Path to the VCF/BCF file.

  • reference (Optional[str]) – Path to reference FASTA. If None, uses config.

Returns:

(returncode, stdout, stderr)

Return type:

Tuple[int, str, str]

Raises:

ValueError – If reference FASTA is not provided.

Example

>>> validate_with_gatk('sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz', reference='ref.fasta')
(0, '...', '')
vcf_agent.validation.validate_with_manufacturer_tool(filepath, tool_name)¶

Placeholder for manufacturer-specific compliance tool integration.

Parameters:

  • filepath (str) – Path to the VCF/BCF file.

  • tool_name (str) – Name of the manufacturer tool.

Returns:

(returncode, stdout, stderr)

Return type:

Tuple[int, str, str]

Example

>>> validate_with_manufacturer_tool('sample_data/HG00098.vcf.gz', 'ont_vcf_validator')
(1, '', "Manufacturer tool 'ont_vcf_validator' integration not implemented.")

Module contents¶

vcf_agent package

  • Provides tools and wrappers for VCF/BCF analysis, validation, and compliance

  • Integrates bcftools, GATK, and AI models

  • Exposes CLI and API interfaces for genomics workflows

VCF Analysis Agent
